description: From Middle French sincere, from Latin sincerus (“genuine”), from Proto-Indo-European *sem- + *ḱer- (“grow”), from which also Ceres (“goddess of harvest”) from which English cereal.
Unrelated to sine (“without”) + cera (“wax”) (folk etymology); see Wikipedia page.

adjectives.description: sincere (comparative more sincere or sincerer, superlative most sincere or sincerest)

entries.meaning: Genuine; meaning what one says or does; heartfelt.
examples: I believe he is sincere in his offer to help.
She gave it a sincere if misguided effort.
